channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2023120111
item.description:
Report E-2023120111

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading a pallet of waste from a trailer at Veolia's ten day intransit facility, a Veolia employee heard a pop and realized the forks on the forklift were protruding out of the back of the pallet and punctured a 15 gallon 1H1 drum of flammable liquid located on the pallet behind the one he was moving. Approximately 100 ml of the material leaked out before the hole closed on itself. The employee moved the forklift away from the area and shut it off, then proceeded to contain the spill with absorbent. The employee and the Veolia site manager then donned correct PPE and promptly overpacked the container and cleaned up the spill area.

item.title: Report X-2023120054
item.description:
Report X-2023120054

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager notified QA about leaking hazmat on beltline. Hazmat was placed into a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: After inspecting, there was a wet stain at the bottom of box. Also all cans were dented and bent at the bottom causing a small amount of liquid to spill out of each can into box. There was no inner packing to keep cans from damaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leaking hazmat was placed into a red hazardous tote using all proper eye and wear gear to move hazmat to cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023110751
item.description:
Report X-2023110751

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager notified QA person about leaking hazmat in unload area. Hazmat box was placed in a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: After inspecting hazmat box all plastic bottles had loose caps which caused a small amount of liquid to spill out into box. Liquid was spilled on sides and bottom of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat package was placed into a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. After inspecting damaged box was placed into a yellow drum for preparation to next hub for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found coming off of trailer number #953431 , after inspecting the package saw 1 of the containers were damaged. DescribePack: one of the containers were crushed and bent at the bottom causing a slow leak DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was moved out of way of the package handler's area. further damage or in harms way

item.title: Report I-2023090079
item.description:
Report I-2023090079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: WESTLAKE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 09:00 on 8/31/2023 it was reported that the residue LPG tank car GATX 201163 was found to be leaking at the Kansas City Southern Railway (DBA CPKCR) Mossville yard in Westlake, LA. The Environmental & Hazmat Dept. mobilized a railroad qualified response contractor to mitigate the release. Upon arrival, responders found the vapor valve slightly open and lading leaking by the secondary closure plug, which was less than tool tight. The valve handle was zip tied, but the zip ties were not applied correctly to hold the valve in the closed position The zip ties were removed and the vapor valve handle was turned approximately Â¼" inch to close the valve and stop the leak. The responders cleaned the secondary closure plug threads and applied clean Teflon tape before installing the secondary closure plug tool tight. All other closures were checked and found to be secure. Estimated release Is 0.5 gallons. After the tank car was secured, it was released back into transportation. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This ss to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.
